title: Gnome Empire

properties.value: The Gnome Empire is a monarchical region bordering and within the human nation of Kandarin. The Empire is not referred to as such on the world map and is often not recognised by players, but it has been named as such by various characters, the most prominent of which is perhaps Glouphrie. The empire is considered part of Kandarin on maps, but it isn't known what the exact relationship and governmental structures are between the Kingdom and the Empire.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Gnomish Empire
 This article lacks references.
This page has unsourced or disputed statements. Please cite relevant sources. For more information, see here.

The Gnome Empire is a monarchical region bordering and within the human nation of Kandarin. The Empire is not referred to as such on the world map and is often not recognised by players, but it has been named as such by various characters, the most prominent of which is perhaps Glouphrie. The empire is considered part of Kandarin on maps, but it isn't known what the exact relationship and governmental structures are between the Kingdom and the Empire.

Although it was once much larger, as of the year 169 of the Fifth Age, the Gnome Empire consists mostly of two settlements; the Tree Gnome Stronghold (north-west of Ardougne) and Tree Gnome Village (south of Ardougne). Despite being considered one empire, both settlements has a monarch.

History[edit | edit source]

The Gnome Empire was first established during the First Age, but has changed in nature and leadership many times since. It was, at first, on good terms with the elven nation of Tirannwn, but was destroyed during the God Wars.

The gnomes later resurfaced during the Fourth Age, at which point they re-established their largest settlements; the Tree Gnome Stronghold and Tree Gnome Village. After the elves were forced to leave the region in 1930 to fight in the Elven Civil War, the Gnome Empire extended to cover most of what is now Kandarin, although the humans of Ardougne were an exception.

Some time after the Battle of Atarisundri, the Empire began to weaken under a destabilised government and the soldiers of the Mahjarrat General Khazard. By the early Fifth Age, the Empire has shrunk considerably, primarily to human settlers and attacks suffered by Khazard's Army. This largely contributed to Gnome Empire splitting into two.

Today, the Gnome Empire remains a powerful kingdom, but remains comparatively small geographically to its height.

The '''Gnome Empire''' is a monarchical region bordering and within the [[human]] nation of [[Kandarin]]. The Empire is not referred to as such on the [[world map]] and is often not recognised by players, but it has been named as such by various characters, the most prominent of which is perhaps [[Glouphrie]]. The empire is considered part of Kandarin on maps, but it isn't known what the exact relationship and governmental structures are between the Kingdom and the Empire.

Although it was once much larger, as of the year 169 of the [[Fifth Age]], the Gnome Empire consists mostly of two settlements; the [[Tree Gnome Stronghold]] (north-west of Ardougne) and [[Tree Gnome Village (location)|Tree Gnome Village]] (south of Ardougne). Despite being considered one empire, both settlements has a [[monarch]].

==History==
The Gnome Empire was first established during the [[First Age]], but has changed in nature and leadership many times since. It was, at first, on good terms with the [[elves|elven]] nation of [[Tirannwn]], but was destroyed during the [[God Wars]].

The [[gnome]]s later resurfaced during the [[Fourth Age]], at which point they re-established their largest settlements; the Tree Gnome Stronghold and Tree Gnome Village. After the elves were forced to leave the region in 1930 to fight in the [[Elven Civil War]], the Gnome Empire extended to cover most of what is now Kandarin, although the humans of [[Ardougne]] were an exception.

Some time after the [[Battle of Atarisundri]], the Empire began to weaken under a destabilised government and the soldiers of the [[Mahjarrat]] [[General Khazard]]. By the early [[Fifth Age]], the Empire has shrunk considerably, primarily to human settlers and attacks suffered by Khazard's Army. This largely contributed to Gnome Empire splitting into two.

Today, the Gnome Empire remains a powerful [[kingdom]], but remains comparatively small geographically to its height.
